name: Constant CHOP
description: The Constant CHOP creates new constant-value channels. Each channel can be named and assigned a different value. To create a channel, simply enter a channel name in a name parameter on the Constant page, then adjust the below value.
summary: The Constant CHOP creates new constant-value channels. Each channel can be named and assigned a different value. To create a channel, simply enter a channel name in a name parameter on the Constant pa

parameters.name: Constant
parameters.label: Constant
parameters.description:
From Derivative
		
		
		
		
		Jump to navigation
		Jump to search
		
The Constant  creates new constant-value channels. Each channel can be named and assigned a different value. To create a channel, simply enter a channel name in a name parameter on the Constant page, then adjust the below value.		
The  interval (length of time) is one sample long by default (one sample at index 0 = frame 1). An interval range can be optionally set in the Channel page.
You can use Pattern Expansion like geo[1-4][xyz] to generate multiple channels in one line.
A simple Constant  with no inputs is the most common use of the . However, the channels names and values can be set up by connecting any  to its input and clicking the Snapshot Input button (Snap page). This allows you to get some channels from another  and adjust them with sliders in the Constant .			
The second input can be used to add offsets to the constant values. When the second input (Active) is greater than zero, any change to the first input will be added to the output of the . This is useful for adjusting Constant  values from external input devices like a MIDI slider box. For example you can connect the mouse or a MIDI slider box to a Mouse In CHOP or MIDI In CHOP, and you can raise/lower the Constant  values by holding the Active input On, while moving the mouse or sliders.
constantCHOP_Class

Contents
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 





The channel is created if there is a name in the Name field. You can enter channel name patterns in the Name field, so you can create many channels with the same value. For example, try entering:				

geo[1-5:2]:s[xyz]

in the first channel field instead of "chan1". See Pattern Expansion, Pattern Matching.

  const - Sequence of name/value pairs defining the channels



  const0name - The name of the channel.



  const0value - The value of the channel.






		
The Constant  can preset its channel names and values using the Snap page. We often want to grab some channels (Snapshot) and edit them later.

  snap - The optional first  input on Constant is used when the Snapshot Input button is pressed. At this time, the channel names and values at the  input at the current frame are used to initialize the channel names and values of the constant sliders.	
To snap channels from other OPs, connect a Parameter  to the Constant  and hit Snapshot Input.			
You can simulate the pressing of the Snapshot Input button from a script. To simulate the clicking of a  dialog box button from a script use the Par Class pulse() Method:
Example:






  first - The First Channel parameter is used to select a smaller set of the incoming channels. This is useful if the number of incoming channels is greater than the 40 channels the Constant  can hold, and you must break it into several CHOPs.



  current - This is used with the second input as described above, when you want to add a displacement to channels by using external devices or sources.	
When Active Needs Current is On, the second  input (the Active input) has an effect only if the Constant  is the current .
When Active Needs Current is Off, the Constant  is affected any time the Active input is on (greater than 0).
This is used by the Channel Editor when editing keyframes using CHOPs. An input device like a button in the Keyboard In  or a MIDI keyboard can be fed to the Active input of many Constant CHOPs. Only the current  will be affected if this option is On.




  single - Turn this Off to make constant channels that are longer than one .



  start - Start and end of the interval, expressed in Units (seconds, frames or samples). The parameters are expressed in the Units found on the Common page. To set the  to be 100 samples long, Set Units to Samples, Single  Off and Start / End to 0 and 99.



  startunit -  - Select the units to use for this parameter, Samples, Frames, or Seconds.

 samples - frames - seconds -

  end - Start and end of the interval, expressed in Units (seconds, frames or samples). The parameters are expressed in the Units found on the Common page. To set the  to be 100 samples long, Set Units to Samples, Single  Off and Start / End to 0 and 99.



  endunit -  - Select the units to use for this parameter, Samples, Frames, or Seconds.

 samples - frames - seconds -

  rate - The sample rate of the channels, in samples per second.



  left -  - The left extend conditions (before range).

 hold - Hold the current value of the channel. slope - Continue the slope before the start of the channel. cycle - Cycle the channel repeatedly. mirror - Cycle the channel repeatedly, mirroring every other cycle. default - Use the constant value specified in the Default Value parameter.

  right -  - The right extend conditions (after range).

 hold - Hold the current value of the channel. slope - Continue the slope after the end of the channel. cycle - Cycle the channel repeatedly. mirror - Cycle the channel repeatedly, mirroring every other cycle. default - Use the constant value specified in the Default Value parameter.

  defval - The value used for the Default Value extend condition.





  timeslice - Turning this on forces the channels to be "Time Sliced".  A  is the time between the last cook frame and the current cook frame.



  scope - To determine which channels get affected, some CHOPs use a  string on the Common page.



  srselect -  - Handle cases where multiple input CHOPs' sample rates are different. When Resampling occurs, the curves are interpolated according to the Interpolation Method Option, or "Linear" if the Interpolate Options are not available.

 first - Use rate of first input to resample others. max - Resample to the highest sample rate. min - Resample to the lowest sample rate. err - Doesn't accept conflicting sample rates.

  exportmethod -  - This will determine how to connect the  channel to the parameter. Refer to the Export article for more information.

 datindex - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the index of the channel in the . datname - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the name of the channel in the . autoname - The channel is the full destination of where to export to, such has geo1/transform1:tx.

  autoexportroot - This path points to the root node where all of the paths that exporting by Channel Name is : are relative to.



  exporttable - The  used to hold the export information when using the  Table  Methods (See above).





 -
 -

Extra Information for the Constant  can be accessed via an Info CHOP.



 - Start of the  interval in samples. - Number of samples in the . - The samplerate of the channels in frames per second. - Number of channels in the . - 1 if  is  enabled, 0 otherwise. - A count of how often the export connections have been updated.
 - Number of times the operator has cooked since the process started. - Duration of the last cook in milliseconds. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the component timeline. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the absolute time. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator started cooking in the frame it was cooked. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator finished cooking in the frame it was cooked. - 1 if operator was cooked this frame. - Number of warnings in this operator if any. - Number of errors in this operator if any.
TouchDesigner Build: Latest\nwikieditorwikieditorwikieditorwikieditorwikieditor2022.241402021.100002020.200002018.28070before 2018.28070
CHOPs
• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • 

An Operator Family which operate on Channels (a sequence of numbers (Samples)) which are used for animation, audio, mathematics, simulation, logic, UI construction, and data streamed from/to devices and protocols.



A CHOP outputs one or more channels, where a channel is simply a sequence of numbers (Samples), representing motion, audio, etc. Channels are passed between CHOPs in TouchDesigner networks. Channels can be Exported to Parameters.



samples-per-second of a CHOP. Each CHOP in your network has a sample rate. In contrast, the overall timeline has a Frame Rate, which is the number of frames to cook and display per second, generally your monitor display frequency, default 60.



The term "Frame" is a measurement of time used (1) in the Timeline, (2) as a time-unit in CHOPs, and (3) as a time unit in movie files that are read into TOPs and written out from TOPs. The frame rate is the frames per second (FPS).



samples-per-second of a CHOP. Each CHOP in your network has a sample rate. In contrast, the overall timeline has a Frame Rate, which is the number of frames to cook and display per second, generally your monitor display frequency, default 60.



A Time Slice is the time from the last cook frame to the current cook frame. In CHOPs it is the set of short channels that contain the CHOP channels' samples between the last and the current cook frame.



A parameter in most CHOPs that restricts which channels of that CHOP will be affected. Normally all channels of a CHOP are affected by the operator. TOPs have Channel Mask, a similar feature.



Exporting is the connection of CHOP channels to parameters of operators. The output of each exporting CHOP is one or more channels, active only while the CHOP Viewer is on. The current value of a channel can be exported to a parameter of any operator, overriding that parameter's value. See Parameter.



An Operator Family that manipulates text strings: multi-line text or tables. Multi-line text is often a python Script or GLSL Shader, but can be any multi-line text. Tables are rows and columns of cells, each containing a text string.



The location of an operator within the TouchDesigner environment, for example, /geo1/circle1, a node called circle1 in a component called geo1. The path / is called Root. This path is displayed at the top of every Pane, showing which Component's network you are currently in. To refer instead to a filesystem folder, directory, disk file or http: address, see Folder.



Every operator in TouchDesigner has a set of control Parameters that can be integer or floating point numbers, menus, binary toggles, text strings or operator paths, which determine the output of the operator.



TouchDesigner is a hierarchy of components. "root" is the top-most network in the hierarchy. The Network Path or Path for root is simply /. A typical path is /project1/moviein1.








Retrieved from "https://docs.derivative.ca/index.php?title=Constant_CHOP&oldid=32267"
		Category: CHOPs

An Operator Family which operate on Channels (a sequence of numbers (Samples)) which are used for animation, audio, mathematics, simulation, logic, UI construction, and data streamed from/to devices and protocols.



A CHOP outputs one or more channels, where a channel is simply a sequence of numbers (Samples), representing motion, audio, etc. Channels are passed between CHOPs in TouchDesigner networks. Channels can be Exported to Parameters.



samples-per-second of a CHOP. Each CHOP in your network has a sample rate. In contrast, the overall timeline has a Frame Rate, which is the number of frames to cook and display per second, generally your monitor display frequency, default 60.



The term "Frame" is a measurement of time used (1) in the Timeline, (2) as a time-unit in CHOPs, and (3) as a time unit in movie files that are read into TOPs and written out from TOPs. The frame rate is the frames per second (FPS).



samples-per-second of a CHOP. Each CHOP in your network has a sample rate. In contrast, the overall timeline has a Frame Rate, which is the number of frames to cook and display per second, generally your monitor display frequency, default 60.



A Time Slice is the time from the last cook frame to the current cook frame. In CHOPs it is the set of short channels that contain the CHOP channels' samples between the last and the current cook frame.



A parameter in most CHOPs that restricts which channels of that CHOP will be affected. Normally all channels of a CHOP are affected by the operator. TOPs have Channel Mask, a similar feature.



Exporting is the connection of CHOP channels to parameters of operators. The output of each exporting CHOP is one or more channels, active only while the CHOP Viewer is on. The current value of a channel can be exported to a parameter of any operator, overriding that parameter's value. See Parameter.



An Operator Family that manipulates text strings: multi-line text or tables. Multi-line text is often a python Script or GLSL Shader, but can be any multi-line text. Tables are rows and columns of cells, each containing a text string.



The location of an operator within the TouchDesigner environment, for example, /geo1/circle1, a node called circle1 in a component called geo1. The path / is called Root. This path is displayed at the top of every Pane, showing which Component's network you are currently in. To refer instead to a filesystem folder, directory, disk file or http: address, see Folder.



Every operator in TouchDesigner has a set of control Parameters that can be integer or floating point numbers, menus, binary toggles, text strings or operator paths, which determine the output of the operator.



TouchDesigner is a hierarchy of components. "root" is the top-most network in the hierarchy. The Network Path or Path for root is simply /. A typical path is /project1/moviein1.








Retrieved from "https://docs.derivative.ca/index.php?title=Constant_CHOP&oldid=32267"

parameters.name: Constant
parameters.label: Constant
parameters.description:
const - Sequence of name/value pairs defining the channels



  const0name - The name of the channel.



  const0value - The value of the channel.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.label: Name
parameters.description: const0name - The name of the channel.

parameters.name: Value
parameters.label: Value
parameters.description: const0value - The value of the channel.

parameters.name: Snapshot Input
parameters.label: Snapshot Input
parameters.description:
snap - The optional first  input on Constant is used when the Snapshot Input button is pressed. At this time, the channel names and values at the  input at the current frame are used to initialize the channel names and values of the constant sliders.	
To snap channels from other OPs, connect a Parameter  to the Constant  and hit Snapshot Input.			
You can simulate the pressing of the Snapshot Input button from a script. To simulate the clicking of a  dialog box button from a script use the Par Class pulse() Method:
Example:

parameters.name: First Channel
parameters.label: First Channel
parameters.description: first - The First Channel parameter is used to select a smaller set of the incoming channels. This is useful if the number of incoming channels is greater than the 40 channels the Constant  can hold, and you must break it into several CHOPs.

parameters.name: Active Needs Current
parameters.label: Active Needs Current
parameters.description:
current - This is used with the second input as described above, when you want to add a displacement to channels by using external devices or sources.	
When Active Needs Current is On, the second  input (the Active input) has an effect only if the Constant  is the current .
When Active Needs Current is Off, the Constant  is affected any time the Active input is on (greater than 0).
This is used by the Channel Editor when editing keyframes using CHOPs. An input device like a button in the Keyboard In  or a MIDI keyboard can be fed to the Active input of many Constant CHOPs. Only the current  will be affected if this option is On.

parameters.name: Single Sample
parameters.label: Single Sample
parameters.description: single - Turn this Off to make constant channels that are longer than one .

parameters.name: Start
parameters.label: Start
parameters.description: start - Start and end of the interval, expressed in Units (seconds, frames or samples). The parameters are expressed in the Units found on the Common page. To set the  to be 100 samples long, Set Units to Samples, Single  Off and Start / End to 0 and 99.

parameters.name: Start Unit
parameters.label: Start Unit
parameters.description:
startunit -  - Select the units to use for this parameter, Samples, Frames, or Seconds.

 samples - frames - seconds -

parameters.name: I
parameters.label: I
parameters.description: samples - frames - seconds -

parameters.name: End
parameters.label: End
parameters.description: end - Start and end of the interval, expressed in Units (seconds, frames or samples). The parameters are expressed in the Units found on the Common page. To set the  to be 100 samples long, Set Units to Samples, Single  Off and Start / End to 0 and 99.

parameters.name: End Unit
parameters.label: End Unit
parameters.description:
endunit -  - Select the units to use for this parameter, Samples, Frames, or Seconds.

 samples - frames - seconds -

parameters.label: I
parameters.description: samples - frames - seconds -

parameters.name: Sample Rate
parameters.label: Sample Rate
parameters.description: rate - The sample rate of the channels, in samples per second.

parameters.name: Extend Left
parameters.label: Extend Left
parameters.description:
left -  - The left extend conditions (before range).

 hold - Hold the current value of the channel. slope - Continue the slope before the start of the channel. cycle - Cycle the channel repeatedly. mirror - Cycle the channel repeatedly, mirroring every other cycle. default - Use the constant value specified in the Default Value parameter.

parameters.name: Hold
parameters.label: Hold
parameters.description: hold - Hold the current value of the channel. slope - Continue the slope before the start of the channel. cycle - Cycle the channel repeatedly. mirror - Cycle the channel repeatedly, mirroring every other cycle. default - Use the constant value specified in the Default Value parameter.

parameters.name: Extend Right
parameters.label: Extend Right
parameters.description:
right -  - The right extend conditions (after range).

 hold - Hold the current value of the channel. slope - Continue the slope after the end of the channel. cycle - Cycle the channel repeatedly. mirror - Cycle the channel repeatedly, mirroring every other cycle. default - Use the constant value specified in the Default Value parameter.

parameters.name: Hold
parameters.label: Hold
parameters.description: hold - Hold the current value of the channel. slope - Continue the slope after the end of the channel. cycle - Cycle the channel repeatedly. mirror - Cycle the channel repeatedly, mirroring every other cycle. default - Use the constant value specified in the Default Value parameter.

parameters.name: Default Value
parameters.label: Default Value
parameters.description: defval - The value used for the Default Value extend condition.

parameters.name: Time Slice
parameters.label: Time Slice
parameters.description: timeslice - Turning this on forces the channels to be "Time Sliced".  A  is the time between the last cook frame and the current cook frame.

parameters.name: Scope
parameters.label: Scope
parameters.description: scope - To determine which channels get affected, some CHOPs use a  string on the Common page.

parameters.name: Sample Rate Match
parameters.label: Sample Rate Match
parameters.description:
srselect -  - Handle cases where multiple input CHOPs' sample rates are different. When Resampling occurs, the curves are interpolated according to the Interpolation Method Option, or "Linear" if the Interpolate Options are not available.

 first - Use rate of first input to resample others. max - Resample to the highest sample rate. min - Resample to the lowest sample rate. err - Doesn't accept conflicting sample rates.

parameters.name: Resample At First Input's Rate
parameters.label: Resample At First Input's Rate
parameters.description: first - Use rate of first input to resample others. max - Resample to the highest sample rate. min - Resample to the lowest sample rate. err - Doesn't accept conflicting sample rates.

parameters.name: Export Method
parameters.label: Export Method
parameters.description:
exportmethod -  - This will determine how to connect the  channel to the parameter. Refer to the Export article for more information.

 datindex - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the index of the channel in the . datname - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the name of the channel in the . autoname - The channel is the full destination of where to export to, such has geo1/transform1:tx.

parameters.name: DAT Table by Index
parameters.label: DAT Table by Index
parameters.description: datindex - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the index of the channel in the . datname - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the name of the channel in the . autoname - The channel is the full destination of where to export to, such has geo1/transform1:tx.

parameters.name: Export Root
parameters.label: Export Root
parameters.description: autoexportroot - This path points to the root node where all of the paths that exporting by Channel Name is : are relative to.

parameters.name: Export Table
parameters.label: Export Table
parameters.description: exporttable - The  used to hold the export information when using the  Table  Methods (See above).
